notesStmt.note: A contract of sale: folio 232r (the bottom of page). Yitsḥaḳ mi-Modena: inscribed, folio 1v. Shelomoh ben Mosheh mi-Rimini: folio 232v. Shelomoh ben Mordekhai: inscribed in a deed of sale, folio 232v. The manuscript was sold by Menaḥem ben Mosheh ben Shelomoh. A record of sale in Italian and Hebrew, folio 233r ('libry 116 solidy 15'). A Latin note related to censorship: 1555 die XI dec[em]bris. Revisus p[er] d jac[obu]m Geraldini comiss[arium] ap[osto]lieum Caesar Belliossus Curiae Ep[iscopa]lis Bonon[iensis] et dicti comiss[arii] not[a]r[ius] man[da]t[us] s[ul]s[cripsit]: folio 1v (bottom). Laurentius Franguellus (fl. until 1596): inscribed with his name, 1575 (folio 231v); see 78, appendix § 105-110. Folio 1r and 232v contain doodles.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: The first three books of Maimonides' Mishneh Torah.

collation.p: 29 quires of 8 leaves each, numbered with Hebrew letters and marked by catchwords.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Sefardi semi-cursive script of the 14th century. Se῾adyah bar Yosef ben Muḳatil: inscribed, folio 232r.

binding.p: Post-1600. Dark brown leather. Spine title: 'Maimonides. Mishneh Torah. Hebrew. Vol. I. Brit. Mus. Additional 17,056.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Thomas Rodd the younger (b. 1796, d. 1849): purchased from him by the British Museum on 23 October 1847: Macdonald's sale, lot 166: inscribed, folio [234v].
